flawed_nl_solution:
If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34
Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.
Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=77>>77 years forty years from now.
Their combined ages forty years from now will be 77+54 = <<77+54=131>>131 years
#### 131

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 74, not 77. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
